description: Numbers that are congruent to {3, 5} mod 7.
comments: Primitive roots of 7. The first differences are periodic: 2,5,2,5,2,5.... - _Paolo P. Lava_, Feb 29 2008
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,-1).
formula: a(n)=-4+(1/2)*Sum_{k=0..n}{7-3*(-1)^n}, with n>=1 - _Paolo P. Lava_, Feb 29 2008a(n)=7*n-a(n-1)-6, n>1. [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 05 2010]Contribution from _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 08 2010: (Start)G.f.: x*(3+2*x+2*x^2)/((1+x)*(1-x)^2).a(n)-a(n-1)-a(n-2)+a(n-3)=0 for n>3.a(n)=(14*n-5-3*(-1)^n)/4. (End)
maple: P:=proc(n,m) local a,i,ok; for i from 1 by 1 to n do if (i^(m-1) mod m)=1 then a:=1; ok:=1; while a<m-1 do if (i^a mod m)=1 then ok:=0; fi; a:=a+1; od; if ok=1 then print(i); fi; fi; od; end: P(100,7); - _Paolo P. Lava_, Feb 29 2008
